intro: Cynoglossum pictum var. siculum, commonly known as the Sicilian bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple, often with intricate patterns. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long flowering period, which extends from late spring to early autumn.
